properties.tooltip: Specifies the number of replicas of data on multiple nodes.

The compact storage directive is used for backward compatibility of CQL 2 applications and data in the legacy (Thrift) storage engine format. To take advantage of CQL 3 capabilities, do not use this directive in new applications. When you create a table using compound primary keys, for every piece of data stored, he column name needs to be stored along with it. Instead of each non-primary key column being stored such that each column corresponds to one column on disk, an entire row is stored in a single column on disk, hence the name compact storage.
